medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms were referred at 75 days of age, beginning with feeding problems, jaundice, growth delay, and neuromotor delay. The patient presented with severe hypotonia, large posterior fontanel, hoarse cry, dry skin, and epicanthus. Substitutive L-T4 treatment was started at 81 days of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital isolated central hypothyroidism (ICH) due to a novel homozygous mutation of the TSH Î² gene (Q49X).
medical_history.family_history: Parents are consanguineous (first cousins); family history of normal thyroid function tests and a-GSU levels.
